description: Discover Hackneyâ€™s exemplary contemporary residential projects on this inspiring walk through the Broadway Market and Graham Road & Mapledene conservation areas led by Hidden House Project. Explore how these projects' thoughtful design and development contribute positively to the public realm and the architectural diversity and richness of the area, shaping London Fields' future heritage.

factsheet.heading: The Walk
paragraphs: Join us on this guided walk through two of Hackney's conservation areas, showcasing contemporary residential projects with exceptional architecture in the London Fields area. You will appreciate these projects beyond their private residential qualities, focusing on their contribution to the public realm and local architectural diversity.

There will be a short talk about each of the exemplary projects highlighted in the tour, giving a brief explanation about the history of the development site, their architect, and their design approach. Additional context will be given about challenges encountered during the planning process and success stories of the project, like architectural awards and sustainability accomplishments.

factsheet.heading: The Organiser & Your Guide
paragraphs: The walk is organised by Hidden House Project, a specialised land & estate agency focusing on selling contemporary residential projects, such as those highlighted on this walk.
Andreina Oliva, founder and director, will be your guide. She is a seasoned agent with a keen interest in sustainable urban development and is currently pursuing a Masters in Real Estate Development.

factsheet.heading: General Recommendations
paragraphs: Shoes & Clothing: Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing suitable for an outdoor walk on paved surfaces. Sun protection, such as sunscreen and a hat, is also recommended.
Hydration: A bottle of water per person will be provided.
Comfort Stops: There will be two strategic comfort stops along the way, providing access to public toilets and seating.

travel_info: Additional travel info: The walk is almost circular. It finishes at London Fields Lido/Cafe, just a short walk away from the starting point (London Fields Station).

name: Future Heritage: Contemporary Architecture in Hackney
